description: CloudStackMachine is the Schema for the cloudstackmachines API

apiVersion.description: APIVersion defines the versioned schema of this representation of an object. Servers should convert recognized schemas to the latest internal value, and may reject unrecognized values. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#resources

kind.description: Kind is a string value representing the REST resource this object represents. Servers may infer this from the endpoint the client submits requests to. Cannot be updated. In CamelCase. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#types-kinds

spec.description: CloudStackMachineSpec defines the desired state of CloudStackMachine

identityRef.description: IdentityRef is a reference to a identity to be used when reconciling this cluster

kind.description: Kind of the identity. Must be supported by the infrastructure provider and may be either cluster or namespace-scoped.

name.description: Name of the infrastructure identity to be used.

instanceID.description: Instance ID. Should only be useful to modify an existing instance.

providerID.description: The CS specific unique identifier. Of the form: fmt.Sprintf("cloudstack:///%s", CS Machine Id)

status.description: Type pulled mostly from the CloudStack API.

addresses.description: Addresses contains a CloudStack VM instance's IP addresses.

items.description: NodeAddress contains information for the node's address.

type.description: Node address type, one of Hostname, ExternalIP or InternalIP.

instanceState.description: InstanceState is the state of the CloudStack instance for this machine.

ready.description: Ready indicates the readiness of the provider resource.
